The General Assembly finds:
That public library resources and services are essential components of the educational system; and
That libraries stimulate awareness and understanding of critical social issues, and assist individuals in reaching their highest potential for self-development.

It is the policy of this State:
To continue the orderly development and maintenance of library facilities and services throughout this State, in collaboration with the counties; and
To develop coordinated programs and services among libraries and institutions to:
Provide the widest possible access to the library and information resources of this State; and
Insure more effective and economical services to all library users.
